DOC.brief_summary: The study investigated the effect of diaphragmatic breathing as an additional coping strategy during Virtual Reality Exposure Therapy in patients with aviophobia. The authors assumed that diaphragmatic breathing (DB) would lead to less fear and physiological arousal during the VRET and to an enhanced treatment outcome
DOC.brief_title: Diaphragmatic Breathing During Virtual Reality Exposure Therapy for Aviophobia
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with aviophobia received treatment in Virtual Reality with or without DB. The authors assumed that adding DB to VRET would enhance treatment effects by reducing fear during exposure, thus improving the processing of the feared situation. The authors hypothesized that, as a result, self-efficacy would be increased in comparison to VRET alone.
DOC.criteria: age 20 to 65 flying experience subjective rating of fear of flying > 60 from 100 pregnancy heart disease current involvement in psychotherapy and/or pharmacotherapy
